verses.text:
The word of the \nd LORD\nd* which came unto Zephaniah the
son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of
Hizkiah, in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah.

I will utterly consume all \add things\add* from off the land,
saith the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 1.2  \ft I will…: Heb. By taking away I will make an
end\f*\f + \fr 1.2  \ft the land: Heb. the face of the land\f*

I will consume man and beast; I will consume the fowls of the
heaven, and the fishes of the sea, and the stumblingblocks with the
wicked; and I will cut off man from off the land, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 1.3 
\ft stumblingblocks: or, idols\f*

I will also stretch out mine hand upon Judah, and upon all the
inhabitants of Jerusalem; and I will cut off the remnant of Baal
from this place, \add and\add* the name of the Chemarims with the
priests;

And them that are turned back from the 
d LORD
d*; and \add those\add*
that have not sought the 
d LORD
d*, nor enquired for him.

Hold thy peace at the presence of the Lord 
d GOD
d*: for the
day of the 
d LORD
d* \add is\add* at hand: for the 
d LORD
d*
hath prepared a sacrifice, he hath bid his guests.  +  r 1.7   t bid: Heb. sanctified, or,
prepared *

And it shall come to pass in the day of the \nd LORD’s\nd*
sacrifice, that I will punish the princes, and the king’s children,
and all such as are clothed with strange apparel.\f + \fr 1.8  \ft punish: Heb. visit
upon\f*

In the same day also will I punish all those that leap on the
threshold, which fill their masters’ houses with violence and deceit.

And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the \nd LORD\nd*,
\add that there shall be\add* the noise of a cry from the fish gate,
and an howling from the second, and a great crashing from the hills.

Howl, ye inhabitants of Maktesh, for all the merchant people
are cut down; all they that bear silver are cut off.

And it shall come to pass at that time, \add that\add* I will
search Jerusalem with candles, and punish the men that are settled
on their lees: that say in their heart, The \nd LORD\nd* will not do
good, neither will he do evil.\f + \fr 1.12  \ft settled: Heb. curded, or,
thickened\f*

Therefore their goods shall become a booty, and their houses
a desolation: they shall also build houses, but not inhabit \add them;\add*
and they shall plant vineyards, but not drink the wine thereof.

The great day of the 
d LORD
d* \add is\add* near, \add it
is\add* near, and hasteth greatly, \add even\add* the voice of the
day of the 
d LORD
d*: the mighty man shall cry there bitterly.

That day \add is\add* a day of wrath, a day of trouble and
distress, a day of wasteness and desolation, a day of darkness and
gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness,

A day of the trumpet and alarm against the fenced cities,
and against the high towers.

And I will bring distress upon men, that they shall walk like blind
men, because they have sinned against the \nd LORD\nd*: and their
blood shall be poured out as dust, and their flesh as the dung.

Neither their silver nor their gold shall be able to deliver
them in the day of the \nd LORD’s\nd* wrath; but the whole land shall be
devoured by the fire of his jealousy: for he shall make even a speedy
riddance of all them that dwell in the land.

Gather yourselves together, yea, gather together, O nation
not desired;\f + \fr 2.1  \ft not…: or, not desirous\f*

Before the decree bring forth, \add before\add* the day pass
as the chaff, before the fierce anger of the 
d LORD
d* come upon you, before the
day of the 
d LORD’s
d* anger come upon you.

Seek ye the \nd LORD\nd*, all ye meek of the earth, which have
wrought his judgment; seek righteousness, seek meekness: it may be
ye shall be hid in the day of the \nd LORD’s\nd* anger.

¶ For Gaza shall be forsaken, and Ashkelon a desolation: they shall drive
out Ashdod at the noon day, and Ekron shall be rooted up.

Woe unto the inhabitants of the sea coast, the nation of the
Cherethites! the word of the \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* against you; O
Canaan, the land of the Philistines, I will even destroy thee, that there shall be no
inhabitant.

And the sea coast shall be dwellings \add and\add* cottages
for shepherds, and folds for flocks.

And the coast shall be for the remnant of the house of Judah;
they shall feed thereupon: in the houses of Ashkelon shall they lie
down in the evening: for the \nd LORD\nd* their God shall visit them, and turn
away their captivity.\f + \fr 2.7  \ft for the \+nd LORD\+nd*: or, when,
etc\f*

¶ I have heard the reproach of Moab, and the revilings of the
children of Ammon, whereby they have reproached my people, and magnified
\add themselves\add* against their border.

Therefore \add as\add* I live, saith the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts,
the God of Israel, Surely Moab shall be as Sodom, and the children
of Ammon as Gomorrah, \add even\add* the breeding of nettles, and
saltpits, and a perpetual desolation: the residue of my people shall
spoil them, and the remnant of my people shall possess them.

This shall they have for their pride, because they have reproached
and magnified \add themselves\add* against the people of the \nd LORD\nd*
of hosts.

The \nd LORD\nd* \add will be\add* terrible unto them: for he will
famish all the gods of the earth; and \add men\add* shall worship
him, every one from his place, \add even\add* all the isles of the
heathen.\f + \fr 2.11  \ft famish: Heb. make lean\f*
¶ Ye Ethiopians also, ye \add shall be\add* slain by my sword.

And he will stretch out his hand against the north, and destroy
Assyria; and will make Nineveh a desolation, \add and\add* dry like a
wilderness.

And flocks shall lie down in the midst of her, all the beasts
of the nations: both the cormorant and the bittern shall lodge in the upper
lintels of it; \add their\add* voice shall sing in the windows; desolation
\add shall be\add* in the thresholds: for he shall uncover the cedar
work.\f + \fr 2.14  \ft cormorant: or, pelican\f*\f + \fr 2.14  \ft upper…: or, knops, or,
chapiters\f*\f + \fr 2.14  \ft for…: or, when he hath uncovered\f*

This \add is\add* the rejoicing city that dwelt carelessly,
that said in her heart, I \add am\add*, and \add there is\add* none
beside me: how is she become a desolation, a place for beasts to lie down
in! every one that passeth by her shall hiss, \add and\add* wag his
hand.

Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!\f + \fr 3.1 
\ft her…: or, gluttonous: Heb. craw\f*

She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she
trusted not in the \nd LORD\nd*; she drew not near to her God.\f + \fr 3.2 
\ft correction: or, instruction\f*

Her princes within her \add are\add* roaring lions; her judges
\add are\add* evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.

Her prophets \add are\add* light \add and\add* treacherous
persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done
violence to the law.

The just \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* in the midst thereof; he will not
do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he
faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.\f + \fr 3.5  \ft every…: Heb. morning by
morning\f*

I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their
streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed,
so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.\f + \fr 3.6 
\ft towers: or, corners\f*

¶ Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the \nd LORD\nd*, until the
day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination \add is\add*
to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour
upon them mine indignation, \add even\add* all my fierce anger: for all the
earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all
call upon the name of the \nd LORD\nd*, to serve him with one consent.\f + \fr 3.9 
\ft language: Heb. lip\f*\f + \fr 3.9  \ft consent: Heb. shoulder\f*

From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, \add even\add*
the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings,
wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away
out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no
more be haughty because of my holy mountain.\f + \fr 3.11  \ft because…: Heb. in my
holy\f*

I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor
people, and they shall trust in the name of the \nd LORD\nd*.

¶ Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice
with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.

The 
d LORD
d* hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast
out thine enemy: the king of Israel, \add even\add* the 
d LORD
d*,
\add is\add* in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.

In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not:
\add and to\add* Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.\f + \fr 3.16 
\ft slack: or, faint\f*

The \nd LORD\nd* thy God in the midst of thee \add is\add*
mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will
rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.\f + \fr 3.17 
\ft rest: Heb. be silent\f*

I will gather \add them that are\add* sorrowful for the solemn
assembly, \add who\add* are of thee, \add to whom\add* the reproach of it
\add was\add* a burden.\f + \fr 3.18  \ft reproach…: Heb. the burden upon it was
reproach\f*

Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will
save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will
get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to
shame.\f + \fr 3.19  \ft get…: Heb. set them for a praise\f*\f + \fr 3.19 
\ft where…: Heb. of their shame\f*

At that time will I bring you \add again\add*, even in the
time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all
people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your
eyes, saith the \nd LORD\nd*.
